intro: Uragoga obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate uragoga, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its broad, ovate-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of its family. Its botanical structure includes a woody stem with alternate leaves and a distinct, aromatic scent. Uragoga obovata is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
